author: Jeruntu
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->
Username field of the hashtable is ignored and instead the command uses the current user.
According to [documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.core/new-pssession?view=powershell-7) ***example 14***, this should be possible. 
## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
New-PSSession -SSHConnection @{HostName="192.168.5.10"; UserName='jeroen'}
```

## Expected behavior

```none
jeroen@192.168.5.10's password:
```

## Actual behavior

```none
desktop-pc@192.168.5.10's password:
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: jborean93
comments.body:
Just an FYI I can't reproduce this on Linux

```powershell
PS /home/jborean/dev> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.3
OS                             Linux 5.7.9-200.fc32.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Jul 17 16:23:37 UTC 2020
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS /home/jborean/dev> whoami
jborean
PS /home/jborean/dev> New-PSSession -SSHConnection @{HostName="server2019.domain.local"; UserName='vagrant'}
vagrant@server2019.domain.local's password: 
```

It's prompting me for the password of the `UserName` I specified. I also did a brief test on Windows and was also not able to replicate the problem.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: I can repro this with 7.0.3 but not in a current build of 7.1.0-preview.5.  So the issue appears to be fixed there.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as fixed and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: New-PSSession: SSHConnection parameter does not use UserName field of hashtable
